contentrichtext.text: {{About|the song by Skid Row|the Taiwanese comic|Youth Gone Wild (manhua)}} {{Infobox single | Name = Youth Gone Wild | Cover = Skid_Row_Youth_Gone_Wild.jpg | Artist = [[Skid Row (American band)|Skid Row]] | from Album = [[Skid Row (album)|Skid Row]] | Released = 1989 | Format = | Recorded = 1988 | Genre = [[Glam metal]], [[heavy metal music|heavy metal]] | Length = 3:21 | Label = [[Atlantic Records|Atlantic]] | Writer = [[Rachel Bolan]], [[Dave Sabo]] | Producer = [[Michael Wagener]] | Last single = | This single = "Youth Gone Wild"<br />(1989) | Next single = "[[18 and Life]]"<br />(1989) }} {{Infobox single | Name = Youth Gone Wild/ Delivering the Goods | Cover = Skid Row Youth Delivering.jpg | Artist = [[Skid Row (American band)|Skid Row]] | from Album = [[B-Side Ourselves]] | Released = 1992 | Format = | [ Recorded = | Genre = [[Heavy metal music|Heavy metal]], [[glam metal]] | Length = | Label = [[Atlantic Records|Atlantic]] | Writer = [[Rachel Bolan]], [[Dave Sabo]] | Producer = [[Michael Wagener]] | Last single = "[[In a Darkened Room]]"<br />(1991) | This single = "Youth Gone Wild / Delivering the Goods"<br />(1992) | Next single = "[[My Enemy]]"<br />(1995) }} "'''Youth Gone Wild'''" is the debut [[single]] from [[Skid Row]]'s [[eponymous]] [[debut]] [[album]]. Its [[music video]] received heavy airplay on [[MTV]]; however, while the album itself was a major hit and went [[multi-platinum]] in the [[United States|U.S.]] and other countries, "Youth Gone Wild" as a single only reached #99 on the US [[Billboard Hot 100]] and reached #20 on the [[Mainstream Rock Tracks]].<ref>{{cite web|url = {{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p5444/charts-awards/billboard-singles|pure_url=yes}}|title = Allmusic (Skid Row charts and awards) Billboard singles|publisher=}}</ref> The song was re-released in 1992 on the ''[[B-Side Ourselves]]'' album with '''Delivering the Goods''' single and charted again at #22 on the [[UK Singles chart]].<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.chartstats.com/artistinfo.php?id=5641|title = Skid Row chart stats|publisher=}}</ref> The song is played at many sports arenas including at the [[United Center]] when the [[Chicago Blackhawks]] hit the ice. The State College Moose of the Nittany Hockey League also use it as their theme song during warm-ups. "Youth Gone Wild" is also featured as a playable song on the ''[[Guitar Hero: On Tour]]'' game for the [[Nintendo DS]], the drum simulation game ''[[Rock Revolution]]'', and as downloadable content for ''[[Karaoke Revolution Presents American Idol Encore 2]]'' for the [[PlayStation 3]].<ref>Grace Chen, "[http://blog.us.playstation.com/2009/03/26/playstation-store-update-78/ PlayStation Store Update]," ''PlayStation.Blog'' (Mar. 26).</ref> It is also part of the soundtrack for [[BrÃ¼tal Legend]]. This song was also featured in WWJ as the theme for the returning Isaac O'Neill and has been covered by several bands including [[HammerFall]], [[Sign (band)|Sign]], [[Norther]], and [[Asking Alexandria]]. The song is also currently being used as one of the football highlight songs on ESPN. ==Track listing== ===Japanese 2-track CD, released in 1989=== # "Youth Gone Wild" # "Sweet Little Sister" ===Youth Gone Wild/Delivering The Goods single cd, released in 1992=== # "Youth Gone Wild" # "Delivering the Goods" (live, [[Judas Priest]] cover) # "Psycho Therapy ([[Ramones]] cover)" # "Get The Fuck Out" ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{MetroLyrics song|skid-row|youth-gone-wild}}<!-- Licensed lyrics provider --> {{Skid Row}} [[Category:Skid Row (American band) songs]] [[Category:1989 singles]] [[Category:1992 singles]] [[Category:Glam metal songs]] [[Category:Songs written by Dave Sabo]] [[Category:Songs written by Rachel Bolan]] [[Category:Atlantic Records singles]]
